intro: Licania mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian licania, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Licania mattogrossensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
